br.com.eits.m4j.api

Class Mikrotik

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.eits.m4j.api.Mikrotik

  • public class Mikrotik
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class of the API, it should be handled by sending and receiving data from the Router
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0, 17/07/2012
    Author:
    Arthur Gregorio

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static void connect(java.lang.String address,
           java.lang.String login,
           java.lang.String password)
        Creates a new connection and request the login to make API ready to send
        commands to router observation: this method uses the default port 8728. If you need to
        use another port, use another method of connection
        Parameters:
        address - the address to connect
        login - the login of admin user
        password - the password of user

      • connect

        public static void connect(java.lang.String address,
           int port,
           java.lang.String login,
           java.lang.String password)
        Creates a new connection and request the login to make API ready to send
        commands to router
        Parameters:
        address - the address to connect
        port - the port to request connection
        login - the login of admin user
        password - the password of user

      • disconnect

        public static void disconnect()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Request disconnection from server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any problem occur

        public static java.lang.String runCommand(java.lang.String command)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Send one command to the router through the API
        Parameters:
        command - the command
        Returns:
        the result produced by command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any problem occur

      • runCommand

        public static java.lang.String runCommand(MkCommand command)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Send one command to the router through the API
        Parameters:
        command - object of MkCommand thats contain the base command and his parameters
        Returns:
        the result produced by command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any problem occur
